question: What education did you pursue when you first moved to San Francisco?
answer: I was going to high school, first at John O'Connell, and I also went to a school to learn English in Pacific Heights.
source_text: and what were you going to school for was it for high school or trade High School yeah what high school was that that was first I was going to John OConnell mm-hmm and well I went to a school to learn English too and Pacific Heights

question: What challenges did you notice in the community regarding language barriers?
answer: There were no translators, and all the information was only in English, which made it hard for community members who didn't understand English.
source_text: yes but I I could speak English but I used oh if I could I helped somebody else you know people they didnt understand I helped him I was fortunate to speak a little bit in English I understood so you didnt notice though that other community members had a hard time yes because there was it was the workers they didnt have translators or was it all the information was only in English and only information was only in English and they didnt have that many people they Translate

question: Has the situation with language barriers improved over the years?
answer: I think it got better because now I see papers in different languages.
source_text: and do you think its still like that now or has it gotten better over the years I think it got better yeah yeah because see now I see the papers they put in different languages before it wasnt too much

question: How important is communication for accessing services?
answer: It's very important, a matter of life and death, because if a person doesn't understand what they need, it can be strategic.
source_text: and how important do you think it is for somebody to be able to communicate like uh very important yes and life of death of life because if we a person listening need and they dont understand what she needs yes strategic

question: Why don't you use public transportation as much now?
answer: I'm scared because of all the things happening, and I'm old now.
source_text: but not anymore because its dangerous and Im old now so do you think if if it was easier and you had more access to it like youd still maybe take it or if it was just like right outside of your apartment you think youd be able to you think you would still take it places or yeah I think I could take a bit Im scared because all the things are happening

question: What amenities do you think are important in a community?
answer: A community center, a store nearby, transportation, parks for children, senior centers, and affordable housing for the homeless.
source_text: a community center maybe yeah and have a store nearby I mean yeah and the transportation because thats important parks for the children to play in in seniors senior you know where they can go seniors how do you say them like senior centers yeah senior centers yeah and yeah and like I said building more house affordable housing for the people are homeless they needed a little um no more than the Safeway in Walgreens and so a little what would you say a little shopping center yeah thank you shopping center

question: What activities did you do with your children when they were young?
answer: I used to take my children to Golden Gate Park for concerts and to Chinatown for the Chinese Garden and aquarium because everything was free.
source_text: I used to take my children to Golden Gate Park but they have concerts yeah thatd be nice every day yeah and what else I think yeah to the park I was because I couldnt afford to take them somewhere else so we used to you know I used to take to Golden Gate Park because Chinatown and you know they have the Chinese Garden everything was free in the aquarium to it was free so we used to go on the weekends up there
